description.value:
The mezzoloth makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its trident.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d4 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 1d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage when held with two claws and used to make a melee attack.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The mezzoloth magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The yugoloth chooses what to summon and attempts a magical summoning.

A mezzoloth has a 30 percent chance of summoning one mezzoloth.

A summoned yugoloth appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, does as it pleases (unless its summoner is an ultroloth, in which case it acts as an ally of its summoner), and can’t summon other yugoloths. The summoned yugoloth remains for 1 minute, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner takes a bonus action to dismiss it.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting. The mezzoloth’s innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 11). The mezzoloth can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

2/day each: darkness, dispel magic

1/day: cloudkill

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Resistance. The mezzoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Weapons. The mezzoloth’s weapon attacks are magical.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with &Reference[darkvision]{darkvision} can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

You create a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} of poisonous, yellow-green fog centered on a point you choose within range. The fog spreads around corners. It lasts for the duration or until strong wind disperses the fog, ending the spell. Its area is heavily obscured.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. The creature takes 5d8 &Reference[poison]{poison} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe.

The fog moves 10 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns, rolling along the surface of the ground. The vapors, being heavier than air, sink to the lowest level of the land, even pouring down openings.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.
